msContents.summary: Declaration on oath addressed to the scribe of the Oxyrhynchite nome by Epimachus, an inhabitant of Psobthis, stating that he had not exacted any irregular contributions, and that for the future he would not be in a position to do so. (Grenfell & Hunt)

msItemStruct.note: Text is on one side only, 15 lines written with the fibers. Text mentions the nome of Oxyrhynchos and the village of Psobthis.
Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology collection

supportDesc.support: 9.8 x 15.7cm. Irregular traces of ink on the side opposite the text.

provenance.p: Excavated by Grenfell and Hunt (1896-7) on behalf of the Egyptian Exploration Fund, and donated to the University Museum in return for its support (1901, Dr. Parrish Collection).

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: To the scribe of the Oxyrhynchite nome from Epimachus, son of Pausiris, son of Ptolemaeus, whose mother is Heraclea, daughter of Epimachus, an inhabitant of the village of Psobthis in the lower toparchy. I swear by Nero Claudius Caesar Augustus Germanicus Imperator that I have levied no contributions for any purpose whatever in the said village and that henceforward I shall not become headman of a village; otherwise let me be liable to the consequences of the oath. 13th year of Nero. (Grenfell & Hunt)
